channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Nitrous oxide canisters, 21st February
item.description:
Whilst completing a litter pick there is nitros oxide canisters with lots of empty bottles of alcohol and bottles filled with urine. Please could these be removed asap, we have left them in a neat pile on the side of the road for collection. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car that has been parked in the same marked parking space for over two years and has not moved during this time., 21st February
item.description:
The vehicle is taking up a parking space that could be used by residents/visitors and its prolonged stationary condition suggests it may have been abandoned. It appears neglected and unused, which is causing inconvenience due to limited parking availability in the area. MOT expired in 2022

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bell Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trailer left for 3 years, 21st February
item.description:
An unhitched trailer has been left on the public highway for several years. It is not attached to a vehicle and has no lights at night, creating a hazard. It appears abandoned and obstructs the road. Please inspect and remove as it poses a danger to road users. It is chained to a lamp post

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eltham Hill, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole crossing 406, 21st February
item.description:
This pothole has been left unrepaired for over 6 years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colney Hatch Lane, Colney Hatch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unavoidable insanely deep hidden pothole, 21st February
item.description:
This pothole is ridiculously deep and hidden by a speed bump - it is close to grounding a car! It’s unavoidable due to the pedestrian crossing and resulting narrow road. This pothole has been reported by many and caused damage to cars but is still there. Definitely the worst in the area at the moment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle that appears to have been abandoned. The car has been parked in the same makes parking space for over two years and has not moved during this time., 21st February
item.description:
The vehicle is taking up a parking space that could be used by residents/visitors and its prolonged stationary condition suggests it may have been abandoned. It appears neglected and unused, which is causing inconvenience due to limited parking availability in the area. MOT expired in 2022

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bell Street, Woolwich

item.description:

item.title: Vehicle crash into lamppost and school sign, 21st February

item.title: Fly tipping by building contractor, 21st February
item.description:
Fly tipping by building contractor at the Gascoyne House estate. Van has licence number CN69 EWY.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gascoyne Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old Mattresses & Beds on Truman’s Road, 21st February
item.description:
Yet again, someone with access to the private car park, where these items have been stored for several weeks, has thrown old mattresses and beds onto the pavement and road. Plus there are old nitrous oxide bottles strewn and in general the street is awful!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salcombe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hundreds of beer cans, 21st February
item.description:
What’s wrong is that this grassy area is completely full of litter and rubbish. It never gets cleared and clearly there’s no one being penalised for this. It’s a disgrace.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lea Bridge Roundabout, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole opposite door number 41, 21st February
item.description:
Pothole getting bigger, day by day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Margaret's Road, West Green, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping again by roundabout, 21st February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lea Bridge Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Matress and carpet dumped, 21st February
item.description:
Some time between 10am and 3pm on 20th February, this mattress and carpet were dumped outside the garages opposite no.4 Burwash Road. This has become a regular dumping site.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burwash Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge deep numerous potholes, 21st February
item.description:
Could not upload any more photos as limit is 3 but there are several more huge deep potholes on this stretch of road from the new intersection on Ashurst Rd and Buxted Road as you travel towards Lewis Road. However there are equally bad potholes from the new junction at Ashurst Rd towards Friern Barnet Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buxted Road, Friern Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
